meanings.definition: A fastening device, typically made of metal, used to secure two loose ends by snapping together.
meanings.sent1: She struggled with the buckle on her belt.
meanings.sent2: The buckle on the suitcase kept her belongings safe.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to open the buckle on the backpack.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the buckle that held the team together.
meanings.sent5: The shiny buckle gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To bend or warp under pressure.
meanings.sent1: The old book started to buckle under the weight of the heavy vase.
meanings.sent2: The bridge began to buckle as the floodwaters rose.
meanings.sent3: The tree branches seemed to buckle under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent4: Her knees started to buckle from exhaustion.
meanings.sent5: The roof began to buckle under the weight of the snow.

meanings.definition: To collapse or give way under pressure.
meanings.sent1: The chair legs started to buckle, causing him to fall.
meanings.sent2: The dam finally buckled under the force of the water.
meanings.sent3: The tired hiker's legs threatened to buckle on the steep trail.
meanings.sent4: His resolve began to buckle under the weight of the criticism.
meanings.sent5: The old building began to buckle from the strong winds.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a buckle.
meanings.sent1: She needed to buckle her helmet before riding the bike.
meanings.sent2: He quickly buckled his seatbelt before the car started moving.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to buckle the toy car to the dollhouse.
meanings.sent4: The knight had to buckle his armor before the battle.
meanings.sent5: She had to buckle her shoes tightly for the race.
